title: 9 popular markets in Lagos you need to visit if you need to buy pocket-friendly foodstuffs
snippet: Lagos is indubitably the commercial hub of Nigeria; it is a cosmopolitan metropolis that serves as a midpoint for trade, industrialization, and a financial paradise for food marketers. It is conceivable that the reason for the establishment of numerous restaurants and food hubs in Lagos is because of food accessibility.

content.paragraph: Food marketers are spread all over Lagos, but to purchase quality food materials you need to know veritable sources and their locations. Here are some great markets to visit if you're looking for quality foodstuffs

headline.title: Oyingbo market
headline.snippet: Located around Ebute Metta, this ancient market sells quality vegetables, stock fish, Crayfish, and ingredients for local delicacies

headline.title: Ogba Sunday market
headline.snippet: As the name implies, this market used to operate strictly on Sunday. However, in current times it operates every day. Located around ogba ijaiye road, this market is also a known place to acquire quality foodstuff.

headline.title: Idi oro market
headline.snippet: Situated at Ebutte meta, this market is famous for the sale of groundnut oil, bags of rice, and beans.

headline.title: Ijora fish market
headline.snippet: This fish market is located close to Apapasea port, It is the best place to get different species of fresh and live sea fish.

headline.title: Oke odo market
headline.snippet: This market is famous for having affordable foodstuffs like palm oil, groundnuts, yam, garri, elubo, and plantains.

headline.title: Daleko market
headline.snippet: You can find this famous market around Mushin, it's known to be the best place to buy wholesale bags of rice, beans, palm oil, and sugar.

headline.title: Abattoir market
headline.snippet: A large market where you can find cows, goats, and sheep sold for public consumption. The abattoir market is located in Agege environs, and it is usually visited by butchers looking for quality stock.

headline.title: Mile 12 market
headline.snippet: This is a very large market accessible through Ojota. It is the go-to place to purchase vegetables, pepper, onion, and rice.
